Jamie used to be an avid rider but these days, she mostly keeps her boots on the ground.
Riding can be painful and exhausting for the former Air Force technical sergeant and K-9 handler because of the catastrophic injuries she sustained in Iraq.
Today, Jamie Mangan is the subject of the second report in our series ""Impact of War.
Late afternoon is feeding time here at Wounded Acres, the name Jamie Mangan gave to her 80-acre spread.
Vegas is chowing down with a couple of the other dozen horses that live here.
Scattered around the corrals and barns are nine cats, three dogs and one goat.
Assorted tropical fish reside inside.
These creatures help to bring solace and order to a life thrown into chaos on June 25, 2005, the day Jamie's Humvee hit an explosive device near Kirkuk, Iraq.
